bug.author: sameermahajan
bug.description:
In instructions specified at: <denchmark-link:https://www.tensorflow.org/install/install_linux#ValidateYourInstallation>https://www.tensorflow.org/install/install_linux#ValidateYourInstallation</denchmark-link>
it states: For example, the following command installs the CPU-only version of TensorFlow for Python 2.7: (tensorflow)$ pip install --ignore-installed --upgrade <denchmark-link:https://storage.googleapis.com/tensorflow/linux/cpu/tensorflow-1.2.1-cp34-cp34m-linux_x86_64.whl>https://storage.googleapis.com/tensorflow/linux/cpu/tensorflow-1.2.1-cp34-cp34m-linux_x86_64.whl</denchmark-link>
However it is for Python 3.4 (not 2.7)

comments.comment: Thanks for pointing this out, will fix it.
